title: Farm Machine Safety: Fueling and Daily Maintenance Safety

tasks.task: Ensuring safety and proper operation of tractors and farm equipment through diligent maintenance and adherence to safety guidelines.
subtasks: Reading and familiarizing oneself with operator's manuals for specific safety practices, control locations, and emergency procedures.
Recognizing color-coded warning systems (red, orange, yellow) indicating severity of potential dangers.
Keeping a first aid kit accessible in all operating tractors or self-propelled machines.
Daily fluid checks (engine crankcase, radiator, transmission) according to operator's manual.
Refueling tractors only when cold and engine shut off, avoiding smoking during the process.
Being cautious when climbing ladders to fuel tanks, especially on wet or icy surfaces.
Preventing overfilling of fuel tanks and promptly cleaning any spilled fuel.
Handling diesel exhaust fluid for SCR emission reduction systems.
Ensuring correct tire pressure as per manufacturer's recommendations and operator's manual.
Regularly inspecting tires for damage (cuts, cracks, bruises) and maintaining good condition.
Verifying proper functionality, cleanliness, and visibility of headlights, flashers, and brake lights as per regulatory requirements.
Ensuring the tractor has two forward-facing headlights, a continuously burning red tail light visible from 500 feet, and hazard warning lights/flashers.
Maintaining clear windows and properly adjusted mirrors for optimal visibility.
Checking and securing shields around the engine to prevent hazards.

tasks.task: Adhering to safety protocols to prevent serious accidents during tractor and farm equipment operation.
subtasks: Observing color-coded symbols on equipment to avoid hazardous areas and activities.
Following correct safety procedures as instructed in operator's manuals for refueling and maintenance.
Avoiding activities that may ignite fuel during refueling.
Activating hazard warning lights/flashers when operating on public roads.
Being cautious and maintaining a heightened sense of awareness, especially in emergency situations.
